titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2666) to prohibit the Federal Communications Commission from regulating the rates charged for broadband Internet access service.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2666) to prohibit the Federal Communications Commission from regulating the rates charged for broadband Internet access service.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-490, by Mr. Burgess.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2666 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit with or without instructions allowed.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 106.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 672.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 182 (Roll no. 141).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 242 - 182 (Roll no. 142).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2666) to prohibit the Federal Communications Commission from regulating the rates charged for broadband Internet access service.
